DataElement.preferredName: Classification Programming Parameter Normal Distribution Kernel Function Variance java.lang.Double
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.:A value that is passed to a routine._A family of probability density functions whose mean, median and mode are identical. The function generates a symmetrical curve, whose position and shape is determined by its location and scale parameters, the mean and standard deviation respectively. The standard normal distribution has a location parameter of 0 and a scale parameter of 1.:A function that measures the distance between two expression vectors as the data are projected into higher-dimensional space.:A statistical computation dervied by using the expected value and averaging the squared distance of all viable values._Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Double-precision floating point number (64-bit IEEE 7540).

A value that is passed to a routine.

Property.preferredDefinition: A family of probability density functions whose mean, median and mode are identical. The function generates a symmetrical curve, whose position and shape is determined by its location and scale parameters, the mean and standard deviation respectively. The standard normal distribution has a location parameter of 0 and a scale parameter of 1.:A function that measures the distance between two expression vectors as the data are projected into higher-dimensional space.:A statistical computation dervied by using the expected value and averaging the squared distance of all viable values.

Concepts.definition: A family of probability density functions whose mean, median and mode are identical. The function generates a symmetrical curve, whose position and shape is determined by its location and scale parameters, the mean and standard deviation respectively. The standard normal distribution has a location parameter of 0 and a scale parameter of 1.
A function that measures the distance between two expression vectors as the data are projected into higher-dimensional space.

A measure of the variability in a sample or population. It is calculated as the mean squared deviation (MSD) of the individual values from their common mean. In calculating the MSD, the divisor n is commonly used for a population variance and the divisor n-1 for a sample variance.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released workflow status per 7/13/09 request of VCDE following successful Silver Compatibility review.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Double-precision floating point number (64-bit IEEE 7540).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
